section.name: Introduction
section.p: The security.authentication module of KME provides for both the protection of application resources and the tracking of a user's identity.

section.name: Single Sign On Authentication
section.p: The KME project does not provide an authentication system of its own. Instead it supports most major single sign on systems provided they utilize the REMOTE_USER CGI variable to pass a user's identity to protected systems. This is a standard practice among SSO systems and provides us with the ability to support a wide range of organizational authentication systems without having to account for the implementation details of each one individually.

KME supports REMOTE_USER based identity without any configuration changes to the base product. If a REMOTE_USER is present it will be tracked within the web application's session and be available to the base web application and all of its constituent tool applications.
